review: I was looking for an inexpensive way to stream video so I could shut off the satellite television.  The price is right and the company is credible so I ordered.  Unfortunately, no one mentioned there are several routers which can not communicate with Chromecast.  Of course, I have one of these noncommunicative routers.  So now I am purchasing a new router and waiting once again.  Chromecast may be the greatest thing since white bread, but it will be another week before I can find out.  This problem should be addressed upfront.
author: DONNA ANDERSON

review: Not Ready for PRIME TIME. The Google TV commercials are misleading.No casting capability with Chrome browser for Android though there is with Chrome for Windows 7. Also, the connection b/w the dongle and the TV drops regularly when casting the Chrome browser for Windows 7. No connection drops when using Netflix, however. At least something worked. Regret buying this piece of junk.
author: Sensei Rhee "Evolve or Die"

review: I have some Sony BluRay players that stream Netflix, Amazon, YouTube, etc but they are really bad about finding a good stream and hopping to a server that has a better connection so at times it will literally pause to buffer 3 times in the first minute of a show so I end up backing out and restarting the show to get it to hold a good stream.  This gets pretty frustrating so I thought I'd try something else...Enter the Chromecast!  I was pretty excited about the product, low cost, control from your phone/tablet/laptop.  The one consideration I did not have is the fact that you have no remote other than the device you are controlling it from.  This presents a slight problem when you need to pause a program quickly.  From the PC it is pretty quick because the app stays open and you can just jump over and click to it but with both my Android and iPhone as the controller I have to unlock my phone, if the Netflix app is still up in the foreground it typically refreshes if it hasn't been touched for 5 minutes (both devices equally), then once it comes up it rejiggers itself and then shows that a program is being streamed, you can then tap the program which loads the page and finally lets you pause.Along with that it is extremely difficult to pause a show when you get a phone call on the device you are using to manage the Chromecast.  Or when you're watching a show that has content not suited for children and your kids pop into the room.So basically the streaming works really well but it would be nice to have some sort of dedicated controller that has a physical pause button.
author: Dan

review: This device started out good.  It had done what it said it would do.  i was pleased, until it got hot and burned out along with burning out my new Led tv.  It got hot and burned out the TV screen and when i tried to use it on another tv it doesn't work there either.  It briefly comes on and then goes black.  If you have any interest in keeping your expensive TV's working, stay away from this device.
